content: I saw a few new Backdrop sites posted on Gitter and thought it might be nice to have them rolled up in a thread here.
Alan Mels : Hello All! Please find another Backdrop site on https://www.ionmagazine.ca/
Olaf Grabienski : Speaking of Backdrop sites, here's my latest (launched mid of January): https://coi-hub.com
I had a really simple/short turnaround Backdrop site that launched earlier this week: https://catholicclimateproject.org/
I've got one too: https://bikemonth.ca
Plus my personal project: https://cargobike.ca
I’ve still got several months before mine launches but I’d love to post my test url for possible feedback. Would that be okay?
Fire away
@Laryn https://catholicclimateproject.org looks slick, but if I may comment, the menus could use different hover-over color indications.
Thanks. This site will probably evolve over the next months so I'll work that in soon.
NP, saw something, so I thought I should say something :sweat_smile:
I do appreciate it!
...and it goes without saying (which IS a saying - pun :sweat_smile:) that these should go in https://backdropcms.org/showcase when you guys get a chance. Right?
I am proud to present our newest Backdrop site - just launched at the end of March - sensualwhipsandtoys.com ! It's an ubercart site.
I think I mentioned this in another stream. We launched another Backdrop site - http://hpsconsultingllc.com/ in mid-March. Both clients are very happy with their sites.

@Elisabeth Garbeil - Nice work. Can I ask if you used a contrib theme to start, did a sub-theme of Basis, or did you build your own from scratch. Both themes look similar enough, that I assume the answer is the same for both.

I started with corporate KISS theme. They are both child themes of that. It's a very, very minimal responsive theme that allows me to customize very easily. Any way I can reduce time spent is helpful. Mainly it's the menu placement that determines the theme, because I'm going to pretty much customize everything else. In these cases, they wanted pretty simple site design. I need to do some polishing of the base theme to add viewport settings, etc. but I'll do that later on, when I have free time and can figure out how to submit updates to a theme on backdrop.

Elisabeth

It is very discreet. There are a lot of product pictures, but no explicit pictures anywhere on the site. But your boss might wonder why you were looking at pictures of whips if he looked at the screen closely :-).

Elisabeth

Nice looking site!
I launched a new Backdrop site yesterday: https://www.surg.org.au/
It was a D7 site (upgraded from D6 or earlier possibly), so had a lot of old cruft that I didn't want to bring over. So I setup a new Backdrop site, then imported content with Feeds.
Used the same design (just updated to be more responsive, etc.)
@BWPanda ++ ...that's the one with the fancy block/layouts right?
bwpanda - Dragon Fire (Karma: 19)

Yep, the homepage blocks use CSS Grid. The source order is:

  • Slideshow
  • About
  • Events
  • News
  • Search
  • Facebook
So getting them to display in a different, 2-column order was tricky
